transparency_law.name: South Carolina Freedom of Information Act

response_requirements.initial_response_description: Public body must respond within 15 calendar days by providing record, explaining delay, or stating basis for refusal
response_requirements.final_response_notes: Records must be furnished within 30 calendar days (35 calendar days for records over 24 months old)
response_requirements.extension_notes: 35 calendar days for records more than 24 months old

fee_structure.search_fee: Actual costs of search and retrieval
fee_structure.search_fee_notes: May charge actual costs of search, retrieval, and reproduction
fee_structure.copy_fee_notes: Actual costs of reproduction; may require deposit up to 25% if cost exceeds $25
fee_structure.deposit_requirement: May require 25% deposit if cost exceeds $25

exemptions.description: Personal information where disclosure would constitute unreasonable invasion of privacy; medical records

Law enforcement and public safety records that would interfere with proceedings, deprive fair trial, constitute invasion of privacy, disclose confidential sources, reveal investigative techniques, or endanger personnel/public safety
Examination, operation, or condition reports for financial institutions
Test questions and examination data for licensing or employment
Personnel files and internal personnel practices
Documents related to industrial development projects containing proprietary information

appeal_process.first_level_notes: Must commence action within one year after person knew or should have known of violation
appeal_process.attorney_fees_notes: Court may award reasonable attorney fees and costs to substantially prevailing plaintiff; may award to defendant if plaintiff's case frivolous, malicious, or wholly without merit
appeal_process.civil_penalties_notes: $500 civil fine for arbitrary and capricious violations

requester_requirements.request_format_notes: No specific form required; any person has right to inspect or copy records
requester_requirements.specific_format: Reasonable rules concerning time and place of access

agency_obligations.response_format_options: Public body determines reasonable time and place of access
agency_obligations.liberal_construction: Must be construed liberally in favor of openness
agency_obligations.segregation_required: Must provide reasonably segregable portions of partially exempt records

validation_metadata.verification_notes: All fields verified from official South Carolina statute. 15 calendar day response required (provide, explain delay, or state refusal basis). Records furnished within 30 calendar days (35 days for records over 24 months old). Actual costs for search, retrieval, and reproduction. May require 25% deposit if cost exceeds $25. Circuit court enforcement. Attorney fees discretionary. $500 fine for arbitrary violations. Liberal construction in favor of openness. One-year statute of limitations.
